Key Arguments: The bill is seen as an attack on freedom of speech.
The definitions of terms like 'hate' and 'harm' are too broad and nebulous.
The legislation is perceived to be biased and will be used against certain groups, particularly Christians.
The bill could lead to censorship and punishment for expressing certain beliefs.
The government should not control speech; freedom of speech is essential for combating misinformation.
Notable Quotes: This bill is an attack on freedom of speech, the terms used are so broadly defined and so nebulous that no one will know if they are guilty of hate or not.
These laws are all one-way traffic.
Free political speech is the bedrock of our society and I will fight to preserve this right.
